nodes.bodyText: seeThrough is sourced from the layer name: https://github.com/FabricMC/yarn/blob/20w29a/mappings/net/minecraft/client/render/RenderLayer.mapping#L32
maybe seeThroughTextLayer? Honestly we shouldn't fluctuate between prefix and suffix because mojang do

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -23,6 +36,8 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_382 net/minecraft/client/font/GlyphRenderer
 		ARG 2 matrix
 		ARG 3 vertexConsumer
 		ARG 4 light
+	METHOD method_24045 getLayer (Z)Lnet/minecraft/class_1921;
+		ARG 1 seeThrough

nodes.bodyText: This would make sense if seeThrough had translucency enabled and the normal text layer didn't (in reality both do). However, the real difference is that seeThrough has depth test enabled, which implies that it's meant to be used in a 3D scene (as opposed to a 2D gui). The current name for this bool is purely naming related (ie. "give me the see_through layer instead of the normal one). If we want to redefine "seeThrough", it should in my opinion happen in a pure refactor PR that changes all instances of this naming scheme, not just in select places.

nodes.bodyText:
What does this return? A set of the code points for which this font has glyphs?
Or a set of some integer related directly to the glyphs?
Ah forget about this comment. It's a nitpick and too much bikeshedding. getProvidedGlyphs should be fine
It's a fair point, because in the real world, glyphs and codepoints don't form a 1to1 relation. However in Minecraft they unfortunately do.
